official-title.#text: To authorize the Attorney General to award grants to eligible entities to prevent or alleviate community violence by providing education, mentoring, and counseling services to children, adolescents, teachers, families, and community leaders on the principles and practice of nonviolence.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

short-title.#text: Securing American Families by Educating and Training Youth (SAFETY) Through Nonviolence Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Grants to educate Americans about the principles of nonviolence

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may make grants to eligible entities to prevent or alleviate the effects of community violence by providing education, mentoring, and counseling to youth regarding the principles and application of nonviolence in conflict resolution.
shall give priority to applicants that agree to use the grant in 1 or more eligible urban, rural, Tribal, and suburban communities that can certify—

text.#text: In awarding grants under this section, the
an increase in community, especially youth violence; and
lack the monetary or other resources to address violence prevention.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not make a grant to an eligible entity under this section unless the entity agrees to use not more than 40 percent of such grant for nonviolence-prevention education and program development.

quote.#tail: means a State or local government entity, educational institution, nonprofit, or faith-based organization.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: $5,000,000 for each of the fiscal years from 2014 through 2019

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#tail: , there is authorized to be appropriated
